p: The activity index of E. coli was the highest in the ethanolic extract (value 0.81) as well as in the methanolic extract (value 1.18), while the lowest was seen for Shigella flexneri (value 0 for all solvents) (Fig. 6). The activity index for aqueous extract was 0 for E. coli, Salmonella typhi, and Shigella flexneri but had a value of 0.28 for Staphylococcus aureus and a value of 0.25 for Streptococcus pneumoniae. Here, the activity index of ethanolic extract for Streptococcus pneumoniae (0.73) is seen to be lower than for Staphylococcus aureus (0.78) and higher than Salmonella typhi (0.63) (Fig. 6).
